page.title: 04INDUSTRY,SAUNDERSFOOT
page.content: boats used for fishing.There was not much holiday trade before the 1939-45 war,only Sunday School trips and day trippers.A little boatbuilding took place.The walls of the harbour became very worn and in 1958 Lord Merthyr handed it over to the nation.The Ministry of Agriculture and Fisheries set up the Saundersfoot Harbour Commissioners.Since 1958 Â£600,000 has been spent keeping the harbour in good repair.It is now used for pleasure and fishing boats.There are 184 moorings, 94 in the centre for boats 20-35ft. long.Around the walls are running moorings for boats up to 17ft.The cost of a mooring is between Â£35 and Â£70. The harbour is now full of boats with many people on the waiting list.{ {What a change has taken place in 150 {years! {
